title: Give AP champs something to stop AD burst early
body:
Give a true equivalent of {{item:3155}} . Or if you want to be truly equal, raise the price of {{item:3191}} to 1300 and put the Stasis active on it. Really tired of AD mids spending 1300 gold to become impossible to all in.

AD champs get all the good items. There are now 3 items to negate magic damage, yet there's still only one for AP. Can any rioter explain the discrepancy?

replies.body:
People seriously need to stop comparing AD itemisation to AP itemisation
Riot made sure there are a lot of differences between the 2.
Stop asking for an AP version of *AD Item* or an AD version of *AP Item*
It's not gonna happen, for a good reason.

Mages are NOT in need of a buff, at all.
Lethality items are in need of a nerf though.

Although you are right, he does have a point.  The only viable choice for an AP to build against AD is {{item:3191}} , building into {{item:3157}} or get  {{item:3047}}, and neither of them make for a good item for get first, unless for a really specific reason. meanwhile AD mid laners can build {{item:3140}} into {{item:3139}}, {{item:3155}} into {{item:3139}}, {{item:3814}} , or {{item:3111}} for MR, both can be rushed first (Excluding boots).  Maybe an AP version of {{item:3155}} isn't the best answer, but their still should be some defensive item which can be viably purchased first on mid laners.
Are you trying to say that {{item:3140}}/ {{item:3155}} rushing don't sap the damage of AD mid laners...?
QSS yes, which is why they don't rush it. Hexdrinker, not really.

From personal experience, {{item:3155}}  is almost 10% less damage than {{item:3134}} . Usually, against mid laners who don't rush any armor, I can basically 100-0 them with ignite at level 6, with a {{item:3134}} , and I definitely cannot say the same for when I rush {{item:3155}} .

If they don't rush at least Seeker's then they're garbage or cocky. 

"Oh no, I can't 100-0 them, it's not like I can't poke them once and then 90-0 them".

We get it. You're a mage main.
But try to be reasonable when you debate.
No one cares about made-up horseshit.

You aren't entitled to be survivable against an AD assassin with 9k gold worth of lethality, as an APC, when you can't be bothered to spend an extra 800 gold on a chain vest on top of your zhonyas.  Or buying health/AP items.
just a question. What do we do with said chain vest?
You can upgrade to GA. Not sure if there's any other really useful alternative.

Ya only useful thing is GA. I actual started getting it second/third buy. Gives me armor/MR.
"i dislike buying Abyssal Scepter ever sense the change to it so i just get a negcloak and sit till i want the GA" 
It Stops dives before they even start, and in team fights the mind game of "don't focus the 10/0/3 Taliyah she has a GA no point" is a lot stronger then it sounds.
I can see why people may disagree, I personal wish for a new armor item that gives mana regen think Morellonomicon, but the CDR changed to armor, with a new item in it, that gives armor/mana regen like how lost chapter gives damage/mana+regen.

I can live with how the game is now. My only issue is how strong the items snowball. I can deal with my lane if they build said items, but can't when a 6/0/0 4 item riven tells me i have to stop laneing.
Thank you, some brains in this outfit. God damn whenever mages aren't present in all 5 lanes it is the end of the world to mage mains. Meanwhile tanks only whine when pushed completely out of meta.

AP burst champions are supposed to be better than AD burst champions late game. 

**Supposed** is the keyword here.
When was that ever the case , adcs were supposed to be the best but are they ?
Look at items that build from tear and items like RoD. Mages were supposed to be geared for mid to late.
they are called carries for a reason with the most costly items in game
And the term "APC" was a thing.
never was meta it was adapted from adc
I'm just saying that mages are supposed to be geared for mid to late. I never said they were the kings of late.

{{champion:30}} I don't see how a tank would die to him. Maybe if he kills Karthus and then was trapped in his passive for an extra few seconds and died there but most tanks could just ignore him and kill him.

ziggs and xerath are really kite strong mages, similar thing as orianna, they have rylais then the tank literally will not get in range to matter while ziggs and xerath poke them to death.
syndra is in the same boat as orianna.

Idk why people when they argue mages cant kill tanks forget, you arent just getting off 1 rotation. you arent bursting a tank (a tanks only valuable if they aren't 1 shot after all) but they can definitely kill them

also, there is a reason karthus has shown back up in top lane, and its definitely not jayce and riven

Ok well Frozen Mallet is barely bought, Steraks is only really bought 4th item, and mainly defensive, and Triforce is only bought on champions who abuse Sheen.

On the other hand, RoA is a good pick up on any mage looking to scale, Rylais is good for a bit of CC and health, as well as being cheap (it's a Steraks with less defenses, aka no shield, but more damage), Protobelt is pretty much the same thing, Liandry's is good with any DoT, although a bit too expensive and not too efficient, and the magic pen is godly against ADC's.

roa is not a good pickup on any mage, some mages like velkoz, syndra, xerath, etc, do not get any use out of this item. rylais is now only useful to the champions that it was absolutely core to as it is not just this huge ball of stats anymore. protobelt has terrible slot efficiency and falls off, and is only useful to champions like diana, kennen and situational pickups on champions like annie who need to get close to do anything. liandrys is a really good, well rounded item, but again mostly used by its core users, not simply a pickup on any mage as other items would help them more like zhonyas or abyssal.

other than for the core users, those items are situational as hell. but the ad health items do not have as many dedicated core users as the mage items do because the ad itemization is a lot more broad than the ap itemization. mages like zyra and brand are literally balanced around buying rylais liandries EVERY game, champions like vi and quinn are balanced around having flexible build paths because there are so many more items available to them
